ruby, we need to recalculate style of its descendant elements because

display:ruby inlinifies descendants' display values.

entry.title: Revert "[infra] Move is_chromeos clauses higher in concurrent_links"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ccd496004d210aa62f7cfbbc980c9b3e08fb5dc6.



Reason for revert: linux-chromeos-compile-dbg already sets

--mem_per_link_gb=10 without the CL.

https://logs.chromium.org/logs/chromium/buildbucket/cr-buildbucket/8761771695208862289/+/u/read_gn_logs.txt/gn_logs.txt



Original change's description:

> [infra] Move is_chromeos clauses higher in concurrent_links

>

> linux-chromeos-compile-dbg is hitting infra issues caused by OOM when

> linking large objects. It looks like there is a mitigation for this

> but dropping our symbol levels caused this builder to fall through

> a different case statement. Move is_chromeos cases higher up to catch

> this builder's scenario and allocate more memory per link

>

> Change-Id: Id0048c24c4eb8c2631a4247c91ea1487e6428313

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5105142

> Reviewed-by: Dirk Pranke

> Commit-Queue: Struan Shrimpton

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1235197}

entry.content:
Add MVC components to the extensions toolbar:

toolbar container view and creates a extensions toolbar view

controller. Added to the toolbar view and the web app toolbar

button, after the extensions toolbar container view is added.

entry.title: Fix the broken tests when AppStorage is enabled(Part 23).
entry.content:
When the AppStorage feature is enabled, `should_notify_initialized`

is used to clean the AppStorage to align with the app platform, and

remove the redundant apps in the AppStorage. This affects the test

OneDriveTest.FileInOneDriveOpensSetUpDialog, because the file

app is removed when the FakeWebAppPublisher publishes web apps with

`should_notify_initialized` as true.



So modify FakeWebAppPublisher, to set should_notify_initialized as

false to prevent removing the file app in the test.



This could

BUG=1385932, b:307623506

entry.title: [Extensions c2s] Add policy-blocked sites to site access computation
entry.content:
Users can't customize an extension's site access for policy-blocked

sites. Add this to the computation in the menu view controller, so

the UI can be updated accordingly.



This fixes a bug where an extension's menu item:

- site access toggle was visible, but selecting it had no behavior

since site access cannot be modified

- site permissions button was enabled, which opened the site

permissions subpage even though site access cannot be modified

(selecting the site access radio buttons had no behavior)



Now, for policy-blocked sites the extension's menu item site access

toggle is hidden and site permissions button is visible and disabled



Before: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aI3699WHpoq2zT3ucynN7k47tQdb956X/view?usp=sharing

After: https://drive.google.com/file/d/14ECvfBB5Nvbzg4anDCyhU48CcqLrWr7r/view?usp=sharing

entry.title: Prerender: stop prerender from overcounting not triggered failure
entry.content:
Before this CL, PrerenderHostRegistry records

BatterySaver/PreloadingDisabled etc every time omnibox receives a new

input, but this recording logic is not consistent to other final

statuses. The inconsistent logic results in extremely high failure

rate in UMA, but that does not really reflect the things we'd like to

know.

This CL rewrites this logic. WebContentsImpl::StartPrerendering will

always creates a new PrerenderHandle instance. For PrerenderHandles

whose frame_tree_node_id_ is invalid, it means that the prerender

attempt was rejected by pre-checks. But we keeps this instance alive

to track the historical attempts.





See this document for rational.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1a1mlf_JxMD2018bRZtzCR0J0eqFPY_0myBOGdcV12ts/edit#heading=h.7omvz2uyeznq



Bug: 1505293

Change-Id: I55c6a1d521fdb7fd522a1ce808224cd5720abff1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5069215

entry.title: media/gpu/vaapiWrapper: Scale with VA_FILTER_SCALING_HQ
entry.content:
VA_FILTER_SCALING_HQ achieves better quality than

VA_FILTER_SCALING_DEFAULT on JSL and no quality changes on ADL.

This improves the video quality in lower spatial layers in VP9 SVC

encoding. For example, in 720p L3T1_KEY, the average PSNR is improved

as follows:



Before After

L1: 26.7385 28.1604

L2: 31.2326 33.1460

L3: 37.5176 37.5178



Bug: b:292195839, b:290863300

entry.title: [TLDD] Refactor DragAnDropGlobalState APIs
entry.content:
Context: Drag events usually reach child view first and then propagate back to parent if child is unable to handle the event (ie: returns false). However, drag start / end events are sent to all drag listeners. These 2 events do no follow the same call order as other events - ie: they reach listeners in no specific order (verified through testing).



Since we need to clear static shared drag state on drag end, this leads to an issue where one listener could preemptively clear the state that is required by another listener. Saw issues with users flows due to this where dragSourceInstanceId in DragDropGlobalState was getting cleared early causing isDragSource call to return incorrect value.



To get around this issue, this CL introduces a concept of tracker token:

* The token is handed over to the creator of the global state instance (token is handed during startDragAndDrop).

* The global instance can only be obtained when passing the right token, or an drag event that has ACTION_DROP.

* The drag starter is responsible to release the global state at drag end.



This CL also wraps the entire ChromeDropDataAndroid into the global state, making it easier for adding more fields.



Fixed: 1514917

Change-Id: I889960787bfab3f3a9a294541330df68872ec3c3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5154244

Reviewed-by: Neil Coronado

entry.title: cros: Speculative multitask menu nudge lacros crash fix
entry.content:
On lacros, we can try to display the nudge even if it is already shown.

We suspect this can happen because prefs are read and written to async

on lacros. For example:

- User does action which would trigger nudge. Lacros reads prefs from

ash.

- User repeats action before the pref is read (or before new values

are written to).

- Pref is done reading and callback is sent for action 1. Nudge is

shown.

- Pref is done reading and callback is sent for action 2.



This doesn't happen on ash because read/write/animate is done in sync,

and the pref condition of showing once every 24hrs is more than

enough for the animation to complete.



I thought of adding some scheduling or weak pointer checks in the

lacros delegate, so we only ever query the pref service one at a

time, but it was much more complex and this edge case theoretically

should be very rare as the nudge only shows 3 times, and the user has

to activate the same window before the getting and setting the pref

is complete.



Test: manually using post task

Test: lacros_chrome_browsertests MultitaskMenuNudgeDelegateLacrosBrowserTest.QuickActivations

Bug: 1505602

Change-Id: I89b71ee17d4e60223f9feba8afc7c14cd335a7e5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5084856

entry.title: Image Loader: Create thumbnail with the video frame at the midpoint.
entry.content:
Currently the video thumbnail is created with the frame of the third

second. However, if the duration of the video is less than 3 seconds,

the thumbnail may be a empty frame. This CL uses the video frame at the

midpoint to create the thumbnail.

entry.title: Refactor layout for launcher toast labels
entry.content:
The toast contains multiline labels, so its preferred size depends

on the width of the container - that means that if the toast parent

bounds change during layout, so could the preferred size for the toast.



To prevent preferred size changes mid layout, update the flow so the

app list bubble view propagates the available bounds to the toast

containers before layout pass.

Additionally, refactor how toast view lays out the label container.

The box layout does not do a good job laying out multi line labels,

which generally get cut-off. Part of the reason seems to be that the

label preferred size depends on the current label bounds, which may

later change during layout.

To work around the issue, this updates AppListToastView to calculate

it's preferred size without depending on the label preferred size -

depending on the available bounds, it will calculate the width that's

available to labels, and then use that to determine minimum height

needed to accommodate the label text.

Then in layout, the labels will be correctly sized so they fit their

text, before starting the toasts box layout logic (which will correctly

position labels along with other toast views).



BUG=b:317067114



Change-Id: I87f36ba324524517d43ced446cf57300c3d9523c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5171132

Reviewed-by: Matthew Mourgos

Commit-Queue: Toni Barzic

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1244414}

entry.title: [exo] Keep surface bounds in sync across display layout changes
entry.content:
Currently exo and client surfaces can fall out of sync during display

layout configuration changes as exo does not notify clients of

changes in these cases.



This CL updates surface classes to respond to display configuration

changes via the DisplayManagerObserver interface to update client

and host window origins when necessary.



Follow up changes should look into merging origin changes into

ShellSurface::Configure as currently window position changes can

be comminicated by both aura_toplevel.send_origin_change() and

xdg_surface.send_configure().



Bug: 1489507

Change-Id: Iaa327dedd937eeb9af82d7e83515495a847222b7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5152313

entry.title: iwa: Disable resizing the installer
entry.content:
We can use WidgetDelegate::SetCanResize in ash, but this field doesn't

get sent from Lacros to ash when Lacros is enabled. Instead, ash

considers windows to be non-resizable if their max and min heights are

the same. This CL updates IsolatedWebAppInstallerViewImpl, the

installer's contents View to set its max size equal to its preferred

size, which also gets used as the minimum, which forces ash to prevent

window resizing.



Bug: 1479140

entry.title: [dPWA] Removing all required fields from web app protos
entry.content:
Required fields are widely considered harmful in protos [1]. This patch

removes them for the web app system, so Chrome will no longer crash on

reading corrupted data here and can instead ignore the offending apps.



This patch also adds checks in the parsing logic to ensure that any

missing fields are correctly handled.



One nuance here that is already used are the management type bools.

These default to `false` if they are not set, and that is already used

by the code as `false`. So these are not checked.



[1] https://protobuf.dev/programming-guides/dos-donts/#add-required



Change-Id: Icd49c16a42f9076a9f56dea5b3849b4187152a3b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5166156

Commit-Queue: Daniel Murphy

Reviewed-by: Alan Cutter

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1244402}

entry.title: [UI] Fix Linux browser window border color in dark themes
entry.content:
This CL fixes an issue that was exposed by [1]. The root issue is that

bubble border colors were being used to draw browser window borders.



This CL fixes the issue by removing the reliance on theme colors and

instead drawing the border with a low alpha value (0x26 is chosen

since that's what kColorBubbleBorderWhenShadowPresent used).



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4760684



R=sky

entry.title: Don't enumerate Vulkan WebGPU adapters if Vulkan is blocked
entry.content:
On some devices we are seeing that even enumerating the available

Vulkan adapters is causing crashes. But these devices are also

already blocked from using Vulkan for other uses, like Skia. This

CL uses the same feature check to prevent Vulkan-backed WebGPU

adapters from being initialized.

entry.title: Speculative fix for null deref in NotificationCenterView
entry.content:
We suspect a null dereference of `notification_list_view_`

is the culprit for crashes in

`NotificationListView::GetTotalPinnedNotificationCount`

This CL adds a `ViewTracker` to ensure the

`notification_list_view_` raw_ptr is cleared immediately

upon `NotificationListView` deletion.

Also, added null checks whenever `notification_list_view_`

is dereferenced.



Bug: b:315990620

entry.title: Apply `[[clang::lifetimebound]]` to `EphemeralRawAddr`'s operators.
entry.content:
The `EphemeralRawAddr` API contract says:



```

// - DO NOT carry T**/T*& obtained via AsEphemeralRawAddr() out of

// expression.

```



This CL helps to enforce this API contract at compile time (in *some*

scenarios - the scenarios where the compiler can "see" that the obtained

`T**` or `T*&` lives longer than `EphemeralRawAddr`).



See the new no-compile tests for examples of scenarios that will be

rejected going forward.



Bug: None

Change-Id: Ieb47a853350dad11d30ebb7e8177009b2a5bd627

entry.title: Add a pointy corner to corner-anchored System Nudges
entry.content:
https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6NCoXRkiUATVAaE



- Nudges that are anchored by their corner will have a pointy corner,

which is defined based on the position of the anchor view in relation

to the nudge, every time the nudge's bounds are updated.



- If a nudge is explicitly anchored by one of its sides (LEFT_CENTER,

TOP_CENTER, etc.) it will not have a pointy corner.

entry.title: Consider non APP_TYPE items for first unpinned item
entry.content:
When shelf view searches for first unpinned item in shelf, use a helper

method to determine whether the item type is pinnable instead of

assuming only APP_TYPE items are unpinned - for example DIALOG items are

entry.title: CoopAccessMonitor: Use normal priority task runner for disconnect
entry.content:
CoopAccessMonitor uses TaskType::kInternalHighPriorityLocalFrame

for the task runner associated with its remote. Since it's a remote

interface with no responses, this is only used for disconnect

notifications. We'd like to remove this task type, but using a normal priority task runner causes a WPT test failure:

1. The Bind() call in InstallCoopAccessMontor will (silently) fail if

underlying pipe was torn down in the browser process before binding,

which can happen if overwriting a RFH's `coep_reporter_` in

TakeNewDocumentPropertiesFromNavigation (which causes disconnects

when the previous reporter is destroyed). This causes a task to be

scheduled to run the disconnect callback.

2. The Bind() happens again with a new monitor, which overwrites the

old one.

3. The disconnect (for the old remote) callback runs, removing the new

entry and causing the test to fail.



This happens because of a subtle task race introduced in

crrev.com/c/5049015. Steps (2) and (3) above are reversed if using a

high priority task runner for the disconnect callback. But the reason

this stopped working with a normal priority task runner is because

previously the old monitor's remote would be reset in step (2). Since

CoopAccessMonitor are now GCed objects, the remote needs to be reset

manually to avoid past entries clobbering newer entries.



Bug: 1426364

Change-Id: If44c1b44f6f52ff6112d160af54ffd4b38b359b1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5133001

Commit-Queue: Scott Haseley

Reviewed-by: David Bokan

entry.title: Fix the broken tests when AppStorage is enabled(Part 21).
entry.content:
When the kAppServiceStorage flag is enabled, AppService blocks the app

publishing until it's ready, after reading from the AppStorage file.

This affects some tests, because they depend on apps in AppService.



So add WaitForAppServiceProxyReady to wait for AppServiceProxy to read

the AppStorage file to be ready.

entry.title: [A11y] Gracefully handle parent repairs when role changes + aria-owns
entry.content:
Partial revert of CL:4995912. This only reverts the change that

used repair as a fallback in GetOrCreate().



Specifically, this restores code in GetOrCreate() that called

RepairChildrenOfIncludedParent() when the parent was missing and not

supplied by the caller.



In the long term, we hope to remove cases where parents need to be

repaired.

entry.title: [headless] Implemented code to center a headless window on Windows
entry.content:
HWNDMessageHandler::CenterWindow() is used to position and size

popup windows like bubbles, so it needs to be implemented in

headless mode for them to get the correct size.



The added test is also executed on Mac and Linux to ensure

bubbles are sized correctly there.



Drive by: removed NOTIMPLEMENTED_LOG_ONCE() in HWNDMessageHandlerHeadless::SizeConstraintsChanged()

replacing it with an appropriate comment.

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Fix claiming stream when it doesn't exist
entry.content:
Fix a crash that occurs when attempting to claim a PDF stream that

doesn't exist.



This crash occurs when a page contains an embed to a PDF, and the source

of the embed is changed to another URL. This triggers

ReadyToCommitNavigation(), which will attempt to claim a non-existing

stream. The code will incorrectly try to claim a stream if there's an

existing claimed stream.



This change makes the surrounding comments about claiming streams more

accurate.



Bug: 1445746, 1510361

Change-Id: If4a6216ba5a46a0c304c00466ef244136744fa3b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5177316

entry.title: [User Education] Actionable Alert IPH subtype.
entry.content:
Implements the "Actionable Alert" promo type, described in:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nqx0Ofgwe30Bg2ox8lMsGGsYt_wdw6Rbl6LXYKApuJY/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-Pi56KMZ_pPw2wkctBXN0AA

(google only)



These are for cases where the user must be informed of some situation,

such as low memory or a dangerous download, where an option to

immediately address the situatoin or change a setting is offered as

part of the notification.



Like a legal notice it is:

- exempt from grace period at startup

- exempt from cooldown after heavyweight promos

- higher priority than other promos (but lower than a legal notice)

- gated by an explicit allowlist, so that new promos cannot be added

without approval from the User Education team



Unlike a legal notice, only the Custom Action type is allowed.

entry.title: Code clean ups to field trial shared memory code.
entry.content:
- Put braces around early returns following updated best practices.

- Inline a fd_key lookup into the callee, since it's not needed on

Mac/iOS platforms where the `fd` value is not used.



Should be a no-op, since I don't expect the fd_key lookup on Mac

was hitting the failure mode, but the updated flow makes it

clear that it won't be hit on Mac.



Note: Removing that early return on platforms like Mac is intended,

to eliminate it as a potential cause of the referenced bug. (I don't

think it's the cause, but this CL would eliminate it if we continue

to see the CHECK hit after this code is not run on Mac.)
